alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Laramie Valley; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 08 at 7:21PM MST until March 09 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected along with some blowing snow. Total snow accumulations generally ranging from 2 to 5 inches, with lesser amounts around 1 inch expected in the valleys. * WHERE...Lower elevations of Carbon and Albany counties including Rawlins, Baggs, Saratoga, and Laramie. The lowest amounts are expected around Laramie and Saratoga. * WHEN...Until 5 PM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions due to icy, snow packed roads and reduced visibilities in falling and blowing snow.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Laramie Valley; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin
